info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 3:49PM EDT until April 23 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following counties, Columbia and Richmond.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Evans, Martinez, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta Mall, Augusta National Golf Club, Summerville, Waverly, Westwick, Windy Ridge Estates, Forest Hills, Westover Memorial Park, Westmont, Village at Riverwatch Shopping Center, Blanchard Park, Eisenhower Park, Bellevue Memorial Gardens and Savannah Bluffs Heritage Preserve. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 192 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 2. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
